失.definition: to lose; to miss; to fail

失主.definition: owner of sth lost or stolen

失之交臂.definition: to miss narrowly; to let a great opportunity slip

失之東隅，收之桑榆.pinyin: shi1 zhi1 dong1 yu2 , shou1 zhi1 sang1 yu2
失之東隅，收之桑榆.definition: to lose at sunrise but gain at sunset (idiom); to compensate later for one's earlier loss; what you lose on the swings you gain on the roundabouts

失之毫厘，謬以千里.pinyin: shi1 zhi1 hao2 li2 , miu4 yi3 qian1 li3
失之毫厘，謬以千里.definition: a tiny lapse can lead to a huge mistake (idiom); a minor discrepancy leading to enormous losses

失之毫釐，差之千里.pinyin: shi1 zhi1 hao2 li2 , cha4 zhi1 qian1 li3
失之毫釐，差之千里.definition: a tiny lapse can lead to a huge mistake (idiom); a minor discrepancy leading to enormous losses

失之毫釐，差以千里.pinyin: shi1 zhi1 hao2 li2 , cha4 yi3 qian1 li3
失之毫釐，差以千里.definition: a tiny lapse can lead to a huge mistake (idiom); a minor discrepancy leading to enormous losses

失事.definition: (of a plane, ship etc) to have an accident (plane crash, shipwreck, vehicle collision etc); to mess things up

失信被執行人.pinyin: shi1 xin4 bei4 zhi2 xing2 ren2
失信被執行人.definition: (law) judgement defaulter (person who has failed to fulfill obligations set forth in a written court judgement, such as paying compensation to sb, despite having the means to do so); debt dodger

失傳.definition: (of skills etc) to die out; lost; extinct

失去後勁.definition: to peter out; to lose momentum; to lose steam

失口.definition: slip of the tongue; indiscretion; to blurt out a secret

失單.definition: list of lost or stolen articles

失婚.definition: to lose one's spouse (through marriage failure or bereavement)

失學.definition: unable to go to school; an interruption to one's education

失守.definition: (military) (of a city etc) to fall into enemy hands; (fig.) to take a turn for the worse

失察.definition: to fail in observing or supervising; to miss; to let sth slip through

失實.definition: to give a false picture of the situation

失寵.definition: to lose favor; in disfavor; disgraced

失序.definition: to get into disarray; to get out of whack

失怙.definition: to be orphaned of one's father

失恃.definition: to lose sb one relies upon; to lose one's mother

失態.definition: to forget one's manners; to forget oneself; to lose self-control (in a situation)

失戀.definition: to lose one's love; to break up (in a romantic relationship); to feel jilted

失手.definition: a slip; miscalculation; unwise move; accidentally; by mistake; to lose control; to be defeated

失敗.definition: to be defeated; to lose; to fail (e.g. experiments); failure; defeat; CL:次[ci4]

失敗是成功之母.pinyin: shi1 bai4 shi4 cheng2 gong1 zhi1 mu3
失敗是成功之母.definition: Failure is the mother of success.

失散.definition: to lose touch with; missing; scattered; separated from

失敬.definition: to show disrespect; I'm awfully sorry – please forgive me

失明.definition: to lose one's eyesight; to become blind; blindness

失智.definition: to lose one's cognitive function; to suffer from dementia

失望.definition: disappointed; to lose hope; to despair

失枕.definition: a crick in the neck; stiff neck

失格.definition: to overstep the rules; to go out of bounds; disqualification; to lose face; disqualified

失歡.definition: to lose favor; to become estranged

失準.definition: not up to scratch; subpar; off; gone awry; (of an instrument) to be out of kilter; (of a forecast) to be off the mark

失火.definition: to catch fire; to be on fire

失獨家庭.definition: a family bereaved of its only child

失盜.definition: to have sth stolen; to lose to theft; robbed

失瞻.definition: to fail to greet in timely manner

失禮.definition: to act discourteously; forgive me (for my impropriety)

失竊.definition: to lose by theft; to have one's property stolen

失笑.definition: to laugh in spite of oneself; to be unable to help laughing; to break into laughter

失策.definition: to blunder; to miscalculate; miscalculation; unwise (move)

失節.definition: to be disloyal (to one's country, spouse etc); to lose one's chastity

失而復得.definition: to lose sth and then regain it (idiom)

失聯.definition: to lose contact; to be lost

失聰.definition: to go deaf; to lose one's hearing; deafness; hearing loss

失聲.definition: to lose one's voice; (to cry out) involuntarily

失職.definition: to neglect one's duty; to be guilty of dereliction of duty

失色.definition: to lose color; to turn pale

失落.definition: to lose (sth); to drop (sth); to feel a sense of loss; frustrated; disappointment; loss

失著.definition: unwise move; to make an unwise move

失血.definition: to lose blood; to hemorrhage; (fig.) to suffer losses (financial etc)

失言.definition: slip of the tongue; indiscretion; to blurt out a secret

失語.definition: to let slip; loss of speech (e.g. as a result of brain damage); aphasia

失誤.definition: lapse; mistake; to make a mistake; fault; service fault (in volleyball, tennis etc)

失調.definition: imbalance; to become dysfunctional; to lack proper care (after an illness etc)

失責.definition: breach of responsibility; failure to carry out one's duty

失足.definition: to lose one's footing; to slip; to take a wrong step in life

失蹤.definition: to be missing; to disappear; unaccounted for

失身.definition: to lose one's virginity; to lose one's chastity

失迎.definition: failure to meet; (humble language) I'm sorry not to have come to meet you personally

失迷.definition: to lose one's way; to get lost (on the road etc)

失道.definition: (literary) to lose one's way; to get lost; (literary) to stray from the proper course

失道寡助.definition: an unjust cause finds little support (idiom, from Mencius); cf 得道多助[de2 dao4 duo1 zhu4] a just cause attracts much support

失錯.definition: to make a careless mistake; mistake; slip-up

失陪.definition: Excuse me, I must be leaving now.

失靈.definition: out of order (of machine); not working properly; a failing (of a system)

失面子.definition: to lose face; to be humiliated

失風.definition: trouble; damage; setback; sth goes wrong
